title: Extending the Modification of the Reciprocal Tariff Rates
summary: The document is an executive order issued on July 7, 2025, extending the modification of reciprocal tariff rates for certain trading partners. The order, titled "Extending the Modification of the Reciprocal Tariff Rates," is based on the authority vested in the President by various laws, including the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and the National Emergencies Act. It extends the suspension of additional ad valorem duties for products from certain trading partners, except for the People's Republic of China, until August 1, 2025. The order also modifies the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (HTSUS) by suspending specific headings and subdivisions. The Secretary of Commerce, the Secretary of Homeland Security, and the United States Trade Representative are directed to implement the order, in consultation with other relevant officials.
